arts.ttl: Brentford backline brilliance gives new boss Andrews victory over blunted Villa
arts.sum: Keith Andrews earns his first Premier League points with Brentford in a hard-fought 1-0 win over Unai Emery's Aston Villa at the Gtech Community Stadium on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Dango Ouattara sees off Aston Villa as Brentford give Keith Andrews first win
arts.athr: Ben Bloom at the Gtech Community Stadium
arts.sum: Two concerned sets of fans descended on west London on Saturday after what they had witnessed from their respective teams on the opening day of the season. Now there is one. Never before had Brentford played a competitive match at the Gtech Community Stadium without Thomas Frank at the helm, and there are bound to be doubts over his unlikely successor Keith Andrews. This lion-hearted win over European-standard opposition deserves to allay a fair portion of them. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Brentford vs Aston Villa: Premier League Preview, Gameweek 2, 2025
arts.sum: A place outside the top five came down to goal difference and a controversial call against Morgan Rogers in May, but the dropped points and sloppy showings away from home hurt them in the long run, too. Emi Martinez missed the match in the Midlands last week because he was serving a suspension after picking up a red card in the first half at Old Trafford in a 2-0 loss to Man United at the end of May.
